intro: Viola purpurea subsp. typica, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces delicate flowers in shades of purple, violet, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, often forming dense mats in woodland or meadow habitats. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in shaded or partially shaded areas. The flowers bloom from late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
